INTELLECTUAL.Definition: related to thinking and understanding of ideas

PRINCIPLES.Definition: ideas that serve as a basis of understanding something

UPRISING.Definition: an act of resistance, sometimes violent

DATE.Definition: give the date when something happened

UNDERLINE.Definition: give emphasis, pay attention to something important

ON HIS BEHALF.Definition: for his benefit and interest, as his representative

GRAVITY.Definition: the force that pulls objects towards one another

WORSHIPPERS.Definition: people who attend a church service to adore God

PROSTITUTES.Definition: people who have sex for money

TWIN.Definition: something very similar and connected to something else

SOVEREIGN.Definition: something of the highest power and importance

CIVIL SERVANT.Definition: a person who works for a government service

ENQUIRY.Definition: a scientific method based on examination and investigation of things

JUDGEMENTS.Definition: the ability to make the right decisions

FOUNDING FATHER.Definition: a person who starts a movement

INSTRUMENTAL.Definition: something that had a very important role

EXPANSIVELY.Definition: in a way that covers a wide area

MONARCHS.Definition: the heads of a state, kings or queens

NOBILITY.Definition: group of people belonging to the highest social class

CONTRIBUTORS.Definition: people who play a significant part in making something happen

HE INVITES ME.Definition: he provides me with the opportunity to

SCEPTICISM.Definition: an attitude through which you doubt accepted opinions

SCEPTIC.Definition: someone who questions and doubts accepted opinions

CONNOTATION.Definition: an idea or feeling that comes to mind when hearing a particular word

VITALLY.Definition: in a way that is absolutely necessary

BENEVOLENCE.Definition: the quality of being kind and helpful

BUTCHER.Definition: a person who sells meat in a shop

LEGEND HAS IT.Definition: according to legend, to what people say

OVERSIMPLIFICATION.Definition: to explain something in such a simple way that it leads to misunderstanding

BASIS.Definition: the most important ideas from which something is developed

PUZZLE.Definition: something difficult to explain or understand

EXILED.Definition: sent away of one's country, usually due to political reasons

BANISHED.Definition: sent away of one's country as a punishment

CONSTITUTIONAL.Definition: ruling according to a constitution (laws according to which a country is being governed)

COLLABORATED.Definition: worked with each other for a common purpose

FUNERAL.Definition: a ceremony for burying the body of a dead person

ESTATE.Definition: a large property of land with a large house on it

FOUNDING FATHERS.Definition: a group of people who start a movement

HERETICAL.Definition: opposing the official or popular opinion, especially one of the Church

CORRUPTED.Definition: turned from good to bad in morals and actions

INSTITUTIONS.Definition: official organisations having an important role in society

CORRUPT.Definition: turn good people to bad in morals and actions

ANTICHRIST.Definition: a person seen as opposing the Christian Church

GROUND-BREAKING.Definition: bringing something new which changed things a lot

ENCYCLOPEDIA.Definition: a set of books that give information on many subjects in alphabetical order

VOLUMES.Definition: books as parts of a series

OVERESTIMATE.Definition: think that something is better than it is

TAKE STOCK.Definition: carefully think about what has been said

PAMPHLETS.Definition: a small book with few pages giving information about something

SOPHISTICATION.Definition: the result of being cultured and having knowledge

COTTON.Definition: a soft white material used for making clothes

STEAM.Definition: the invisible form the water takes after being boiled

ARCHITECT.Definition: the person who is responsible for making an idea real

COUNTERBALANCING.Definition: balanced by applying equal force to each other

INGENIOUSLY.Definition: in a clever and original way

LEGACY.Definition: something valuable received from the past

COLONIAL.Definition: related to the practice of a country expanding to other countries
